1.text: When I would heal Israel, then is the iniquity of Ephraim discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria; for they commit falsehood: and the thief entereth in, and the troop of robbers spoileth without.

2.text: And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now have their own doings beset them about; they are before my face.

3.text: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.

4.text: They are all adulterers; they are as an oven heated by the baker; he ceaseth to stir the fire, from the kneading of the dough until it be leavened.

5.text: On the day of our king the princes made themselves sick with the heat of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.

6.text: For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.

7.text: They are all hot as an oven, and devour their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.

8.text: Ephraim, he mixeth himself among the peoples; Ephraim is a cake not turned.

9.text: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, and he knoweth it not.

10.text: And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: yet they have not returned unto the LORD their God, nor sought him, for all this.

11.text: And Ephraim is like a silly dove, without understanding: they call unto Egypt, they go to Assyria.

12.text: When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven: I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.

13.text: Woe unto them! for they have wandered from me; destruction unto them! for they have trespassed against me: though I would redeem them, yet they have spoken lies against me.

14.text: And they have not cried unto me with their heart, but they howl upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, they rebel against me.

15.text: Though I have taught and strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me.

16.text: They return, but not to him that is on high; they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
